name: TheAtlantic
text: This pandemic is once again headed in a very scary direction. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/tU3phBNaZA

name: TheAtlantic
text: Sign up for the newsletter here: https://t.co/ZY4adCYUKG

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "Do we care to match the reality of America to its ideals? If so, do we really believe that our notions of self-government and individual freedom, equality of opportunity and equality before the law, apply to everybody?"

-- @BarackObama: 

https://t.co/Wy895BLJr9

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @AdrienneLaF: “As I’ve reflected on my presidency and all that’s happened since, I’ve had to ask myself whether I was too tempered in speaking the truth as I saw it, too cautious in either word or deed...” 

@BarackObama in The Atlantic this morning: https://t.co/eNCtoj2Mt4

name: TheAtlantic
text: "In a democracy, the purpose of politics is to gain and then exercise power over public policy. Rage-donating to long-shot candidates—of either party—isn't a winning strategy," @eitanhersh writes: https://t.co/eOmoeROVoN

name: TheAtlantic
text: Peter Turchin believes he has discovered iron laws that predict the rise and fall of societies, @gcaw reports. He has bad news for America. https://t.co/8SaACRm3xP

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The best reason for skepticism comes from Trump himself. He’s claimed fraud before, and despite a major effort to find it, turned up nothing," writes @GrahamDavidA. https://t.co/nQZICAf1Dw

name: TheAtlantic
text: Last night’s Country Music Awards featured a mostly maskless crowd indoors. “How does a genre in love with routine respond to a moment in which everyone’s lives have been disrupted?” @skornhaber asked in July. “One way is by pretending everything is fine.” https://t.co/Px1GPi8uEI

name: TheAtlantic
text: SPONSORED: Older adults have long dealt with social isolation, and in a time of social distancing, it's vital to find new ways to connect with one another. Here's how some adults have stayed socially engaged and active in the new normal. https://t.co/qOglc5YU6H @EquitableFin https://t.co/jAZJ29W5OJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @nora_kelly: "Expect intra-party fights to center on three consequential decisions ... " https://t.co/WANGlUmpnN

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @RonBrownstein: Joe Biden was perhaps the only candidate who could've tied together a winning Democratic coalition this year, @RonBrownstein writes. https://t.co/obeCmN94Ok

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @nora_kelly: This new @RonBrownstein piece is an early warning for Democrats about 2024: https://t.co/XyeBpIpQiA

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TomMcTague: It's 2022, Germany has new chancellor very keen on exports to China. Macron is gearing up for his reelection still wanting more autonomy for Europe. Britain still has Boris. Which country will be most aligned to Biden's foreign policy? It's complicated. https://t.co/AeTztRbwVU

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdamHSays: "The best reason for skepticism comes from Trump himself. He’s claimed fraud before, and despite a major effort to find it, turned up nothing," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/E20DtPZmBa

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "I’m encouraged by the record-setting number of Americans who turned out to vote in last week’s election, and have an abiding trust in Joe Biden and Kamala Harris, in their character and capacity to do what is right."
-- @BarackObama:
https://t.co/Wy895BLJr9

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @danteramos: Rage-donating to Amy McGrath and Jaime Harrison might have made some Democrats feel better, but @eitanhersh argues that it's a poor strategy for political change. https://t.co/GBxBx0hQWX

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: "China is indeed a formidable rival, but its Communist Party faces deep problems and possibly even decay. And it is precisely because of its weakness that China presents so complex a challenge." Interesting @DAlexBlumenthal piece: https://t.co/bD3IIFCtF4

name: TheAtlantic
text:
House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy suggested Tuesday that Joe Biden might not be the next president.

In June, @anneapplebaum asked why some Republican leaders have chosen to be complicit with President DonaldTrump’s immoral and dangerous acts. https://t.co/d0ggR7gVzW

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The 2020 electoral outcome—Democratic White House, Republican Senate—was the worst one in terms of getting anything done in the Capitol, and is thus a pending disaster for the country’s sick, unemployed, and poor," @AnnieLowrey writes: https://t.co/aZwTtDm0OW
